intro: Asclepiodora gomphocarpoides, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant features opposite, oval-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds with silky filaments. Asclepiodora gomphocarpoides is often found in grasslands and woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
